name: Domesticated Bird
movedesc: An annoying clip with wings.
moveeffects: Attacks from other characters apply +1 Verve Loss this turn.

name: Domesticated Pet
movedesc: A bothering dance around the legs.
moveeffects: Your first attack against the target apply +2 Verve Loss this turn.

name: Vultavian
movedesc: A pecking attack while stationary.
moveeffects: 10 Verve Loss.

movedesc: Moves up to 5sq from above and attacks with a swooping attack.
moveeffects: 10 Verve Loss.  If not defended, resolve a Peck as a Free Action.

name: Wolf
movedesc: A maul with claws and teeth.
moveeffects: 11 Verve Loss.

movedesc: If there are two wolves adjacent to the same target, this wolf attempts a trip and grapple.
moveeffects: The target gains the Tripped and Grappled Statuses.

movedesc: The Wolf calls out a great Awooooo!
moveeffects: All wolves within earshot Gain 10 Verve and +5sq Movement.  Each target may only be affected by this ability once.

name: Flambug, Callashari
movedesc: Nips and crunches of its flaming body.
moveeffects: 15 Verve Loss.
description: Preferring hot, arid, desert areas, the Flambug and its cousin the Flamebeetle are forces to be reckoned with.  Normally habitating underground, the bugs are lured out when their homes are too wet, or on particularly hot days, when it comes to absorb the heat of the sun before retreating back again.

movedesc: A spit of a boiling stinger.
moveeffects: 12 Verve Loss.

name: Flamebeetle, Callashari
movedesc: A goring buck of its strong facial horn.
moveeffects: 20 Verve Loss.
description: Preferring hot, arid, desert areas, the Flambug and its cousin the Flamebeetle are forces to be reckoned with.  Normally habitating underground, the bugs are lured out when their homes are too wet, or on particularly hot days, when it comes to absorb the heat of the sun before retreating back again.

movedesc: Usable after someone has successfully Defended, the Flamebeetle will switch to its pyral burst.
moveeffects: 12 Verve Loss.

movedesc: The Flamebeetle takes to the air and flies over its targets for 6 squares.
moveeffects: 30 Verve Loss

movedesc: The Flamebeetle lashes out with 2 hidden burning pincers, injecting a target with liquid fire.
moveeffects: If not resisted, the target gains the Burning Status, which they cannot put out, as well as the Poisoned (DC3) Status.

name: Crystal Serpent
movedesc: A snap of its cold-tipped teeth, and a constriction of its freezing body.
moveeffects: 25 Verve Loss

movedesc: Emits a powerful icy blast on the ground around it.
moveeffects: Everyone in a volume gains the Temporaliy: Chilled Status and incurs 25 Verve Loss.  Additionally, walking on the surface requires saves each round or fall prone.

name: Electric Dook
movedesc: A short range zap of electricity.
moveeffects: 10 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A short range zap of electricity.
moveeffects: The zap arcs to 5 targets within 3 squares, and can repeat to targets it has hit before.  Each target incurs 10 Verve Loss.

movedesc: The Dook rubs against an adjacent Dook, discharging static.
moveeffects: All Dooks within 6sq reduce cooldowns on all skills by 1.

name: Shaxl
movedesc: The mere presence of this creature applies electric damage through the air.  Only Resistances can avoid this damage.
moveeffects: 25 Verve Loss to all creatures within 2sq.

movedesc: A glob of sticky electrified goo.
moveeffects: All targets in a 2x2 Shape incur 25 Verve Loss.

movedesc: The Shaxl arcs its Airshock with greater intensity.
moveeffects: 25 Verve Loss to all creatures within 6sq.

name: Sonusting Warrior
movedesc: A blast of sonic energy.
moveeffects: Applies 20 Verve Loss to everything in a cone.
description: A frighteningly large, but rare, dragonfly bee creature.  Never straying too far from the Hive, the Sonusting Swarm attempts to propogate by biting off the flesh of creatures and amassing it in their tree-bound hives.  The Drone is designated for carrying the flesh, while the warriors take down the preys.  The Matron Sonusting coats the flesh in a honey, making it too acidic to eat.

movedesc: A beam of sonic energy.
moveeffects: Applies 20 Verve Loss to everything in a line, 7sq long.

movedesc: Emits a sound to all within earshot so high-pitched that it cannot be heard.
moveeffects: Applies the Deafened Status if not resisted.  Additionally applied 20 Verve Loss with no save.

movedesc: Emits a ray of subsonic energy at a foe.
moveeffects: Unless resisted, the target gains the Deaf / Silent: Deaf, and Scrambled: Stunned + Confused (DC 1) Statuses.  Additionally applied 20 Verve Loss with no save.

name: Fellhound, Western
movedesc: A tearing and clawing maelstrom.
moveeffects: Applies 20 Verve Loss.

movedesc: The Fellhound leaps towards an enemy with a sickening rend.
moveeffects: Leaps up to 6sq. to apply 20 Verve Loss.  If the distance it leaps is exactly 4sq, this increases to 30.

movedesc: The Fellhound gnashes with more furiocity than can be imagined.
moveeffects: Applies 30 Verve Loss.

name: Kirrilith
movedesc: The Kirrilith swoops at ground height through multiple targets, damaging and displacing them.
moveeffects: All creatures in a line up to 6sq. incur 25 Verve Loss.  Additionally, attacks against the Kirrilith that must beat a Dex Save incur a -4 Penalty until the Kirrilith's next turn.

movedesc: The Kirrilith swoops down with unerring speed to skewer a witless combatant.
moveeffects: The Kirrilith skewers, applying 30 Verve Loss.  Additionally, if the target did not save successfully, it knocks them 10sq away with a strong gust of its wings.

movedesc: The Kirrilith bursts down to an area and creates galing winds.
moveeffects: All targets in an Aura Shape who fail to Save are thrown back 10sq. in a direction from the center of the Aura.

movedesc: Let's out a heart-pouding Squaw!
moveeffects: Reduces all Cooldowns by 1.

name: Hildemont
movedesc: Gores multiple combatants with it's three horns.
moveeffects: Up to 3 targets in it's Threatened Area incur 25 Verve Loss.

movedesc: The Hildemont uses its great size to charge through combatants.
moveeffects: All targets in a line up to 12sq incur 35 Verve Loss, and are displaced 2sq.

movedesc: Leaps onto an adjacent target, crushing it with it's huge size.
moveeffects: Targets under the Hildemont incur 40 Verve Loss.  Additionally, the gain the Grappled Status with no save.

movedesc: Kicks a target at their rear.
moveeffects: A target at the rear of the Hildemont incurs 30 Verve Loss.

name: Ciar Soul, Lesser
movedesc: A cut from its bright claws.
moveeffects: Applies 8 Verve Loss.

movedesc: Erupts in a burst of light, killing itself.
moveeffects: All creatures in an Aura Shape gain the Ciar Font Status.

name: Ciar Soul
movedesc: A cut from its bright claws.
moveeffects: Applies 12 Verve Loss.

movedesc: Evokes a spell without paying components.
moveeffects: Can cast Corpus Hastum, Mirrorising Image, Energistic Cone (Radiant, 2d6).

movedesc: Erupts in a burst of light, killing itself.
moveeffects: All creatures in an Aura Shape gain the Ciar Font Status.  Those with a broken source may attempt to resist with Resist Physical.

name: Ciar Soul, Greater
movedesc: A cut from its bright claws.
moveeffects: Applies 16 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A luminal bond shoots from one Ciar to another.
moveeffects: Becomes immune to all damage until the bound Ciar Soul is killed.

movedesc: Evokes a spell without paying components.
moveeffects: Can cast Corpus Hastum, Mirrorising Image, Energistic Cone (Radiant, 2d6).

movedesc: Erupts in a burst of light, killing itself.
moveeffects: All creatures in an Aura Shape gain the Ciar Font Status.

name: Alumental, Iron
movename:
Pummel

Self-repair | Special | 3 | Special | The Alumental completely repairs itself, even from catastrophic damage. | 0 | 0 | 0
movedesc: A pummel of its iron fists.
moveeffects: Applies 2 attacks to the same target, each dealing 16 Verve Loss.
resistances: PRes(10), UmRes(5), LumRes(5), CryRes(5), ZephRes(5), PyRes(5)
description:
A fierce and terrifying creature.  The Alumental Construct is a living engine, powered by magical energies placed into a cage within it chest cavity.  The Alumental is a thing of both magic and engineering, being sculpted largely of clay and metal, but powered by The Flow.

While not expensive to make, they are extremely expensive to power, as they require a source of Divination Magic, and Elemental Magic, and require a name to be placed alongside the magic in its chest, written on the leather of a draconic creature, which does not burn like the other items.  

The construct will seek and destroy the named target it has written.  While within its detecting range (variable due to the strength of the divination magics it has been provided), it will know where you are, and will expend its magics to power itself.  The magics can last months to years.  

Due to the burning effect of the divination and elemental magics, people who attempt to stop or approach Alumentals experience vivid hallucinations of their past and future, wreathed in the elemental magic that was added.

The only way to truly destroy the Alumental is to find its Core Instructions in the deepest of its hearts, plunging your hand into the wet, oily, blood-like chambers of machinery and braving the very dangers that lie within.  Attempting to dismantle takes too long, it will reform with Self-Repair.

movedesc: A slashing whir of shrapnel.
moveeffects: The shrapnel fires in a cone shape, applying 15 Verve Loss to all caught within.

movedesc: A revelation of horror relives your greatest fears.
moveeffects: All creatures within sight must save or incur 16 Verve Loss and gain the Debilitated: Terror.

name: Gigan, Terra, Small
movedesc: A slam attack with powerful earthen fists.
moveeffects: Applies 6 Verve Loss.

movedesc: The Gigan slams its fists into the earth.
moveeffects: All creatures standing within an Aura Shape incur 14 Verve Loss.

movedesc: The Gigan pulls a chunk of itself off for a terrible throw.
moveeffects: Applies 20 Verve Loss.

movedesc: The Gigan wreathes itself in tough rock.
moveeffects: The Gigan becomes immune to damage until the start of its next turn.

movedesc: The Gigan wreathes itself in layers of rock.
moveeffects: The Gigan gains 5 UDR for 3 turns.

name: Nephir, Umbral, Lesser
movedesc: Furious tiny jabs with sharp appendages.
moveeffects: Applies 6 Verve Loss.  Failing your Defend also applies the Umbral Critical Effect.
description: The Nephir are created from pure energy to serve their masters.  Lacking a will of thier own, but reasonable intelligence, they make for excellent servants.  Some magical schools are attempting, and have succeeded, to create these impish creatures.  They have begun to live in fairytales of warning.

name: Nephir, Luminal, Lesser
movedesc: Furious tiny jabs with sharp appendages.
moveeffects: Applies 6 Verve Loss.  Failing your Defend also applies the Luminal Critical Effect.
description: The Nephir are created from pure energy to serve their masters.  Lacking a will of thier own, but reasonable intelligence, they make for excellent servants.  Some magical schools are attempting, and have succeeded, to create these impish creatures.  They have begun to live in fairytales of warning.

moveeffects: Applies 6 Verve Loss.  Failing your Defend also applies the Pyral Critical Effect.

movedesc: Furious tiny jabs with sharp appendages.
moveeffects: Applies 6 Verve Loss.  Failing your Defend also applies the Acidic Critical Effect.
description: The Nephir are created from pure energy to serve their masters.  Lacking a will of thier own, but reasonable intelligence, they make for excellent servants.  Some magical schools are attempting, and have succeeded, to create these impish creatures.  They have begun to live in fairytales of warning.

name: Nephir, Arcane, Lesser
movedesc: Furious tiny jabs with sharp appendages.
moveeffects: Applies 6 Verve Loss.  Failing your Defend also applies the Arcane Critical Effect.
description: The Nephir are created from pure energy to serve their masters.  Lacking a will of thier own, but reasonable intelligence, they make for excellent servants.  Some magical schools are attempting, and have succeeded, to create these impish creatures.  They have begun to live in fairytales of warning.

name: Spellforme
movedesc: The Spellforme raises its hands, firing 2 blasts of pure Arcane energy.
moveeffects: Up to 2 targets incur 14 Verve Loss.
description:
A spell taken life, like Roisendahla do, though compressed into a much faster timeline.  Spellformes are embodiments of a spell, and so their abilites vary and are based around the spell that created them.

Being rapid new life formes, Spellformes are confused and erratic, searching for meaning and understanding.  This makes them aggressive whe threatened, and withdrawn when confused.  They are highly succeptible to a combination of the Charmative and Lingua Comprehensus spells.

movedesc: Emits a spell-like magical effect from its body.
moveeffects: Casts one spell (that it is based on) with the Standard Effect.

movedesc: Emits a spell-like magical effect from its body.
moveeffects: Casts one spell (that it is based on) with the Overpowered Effect.

name: Corvus Collector
movedesc: Opens its chest cage, releasing a swarm of crows within.
moveeffects: Summons 25 crows, which gain a Relocate Move immediately.
description:
A crow-like creature made of sinewy flesh and what looks like a metal birdcage in its chest.  It has no eyes of its own, so it releases creatures resembling crows from its chest.  It eats carrion flesh and bird feathers to make new crows, and it constantly needs to feed as its crow children live but a few lapses.

It is an avid collector, wishing to find its little pretties - sometimes valuable, sometimes worthless, its whims are indecipherable.  It acts seemingly without reason and certainly without panic; if faced in combat, it will release its crows and, unless those it faces has it's treasure or it needs to feed, it will continue on its way, through people if it needs to.  When particularly threatened, however, it will release its great Corvus Maelstrom.

movedesc: Cocks its head and talks in Corvus.
moveeffects: 3 Crows gain an additional Primary Action.

movedesc: Walks with purpose, through any moveable object or creature.
moveeffects: Moves its Speed methodically, applying 16 Verve Loss all in it's way.  Creatures not engaged with a Corvus Crow gain +2 to Defend against this.

movedesc: Rapidly opens and closes its hideous cage.
moveeffects: Increases the applied Verve Loss of its Crows by 5, their MoveSq by 2, and their Attributes by 1, until the start of their next turn.

movedesc: The move before using this, the Corvus Collector emits a horrendous caw, portending its move.
moveeffects: If there are at least 5 Crows alive and in the vacinity, it summons them for a devastating storm of crows in an Aura around it, applying 40 Verve Loss to alll caught within.

name: Corvus Crow
movedesc: Red eyes and black feathers, flecked with dark energies.
moveeffects: Applies 12 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A dive at the eyes of a poor wretch.
moveeffects: If a creature is at least 3 squares away from one of its allies, the Crow attacks their eyes, applying 18 Verve Loss.  Failing to Defend also applies the Blinded Status.

name: Efflorescent Bloomlurk
movedesc: It's last resort, the Bloomlurk will peck a creature to death.
moveeffects: 25 Verve Loss
description:
As lovely as it is deadly, the Efflorescent Bloomlurk makes it's nest in verdant glades and floral fields.  It emits an aura that feeds the vegetation and creates a place of beauty.  But this is a trap; the Bloomlurk feeds on flesh by luring creatures into its nest with welcoming scents.  When it has them in, it changes its scent to one of mass confusion.  Those afflicted find their vision wavering and blurred, and they become highly confused, causing them to attack their own allies while th Bloomlurk feeds on the stragglers and warm corpses.

Should the confusion be broken, the creature changes to its second tactic; it retreats into the flowerbed and duplicates itself into illusions; the original and each copy hazy and wavering.  It then uses it's Attraction ability to split its foes, firing a sticky acidic pollen at them all, though only one truly hitting.  Wily defenders may be able to watch for which Bloomlurk is the true one, as attacking the wrong one causes an eruption of Pollen which weakens and eventually kills.

Finally, should that not work, the avian monster will attempt to flee by flying away.

movedesc: Fires a burst of pollen at an enemy.
moveeffects: Explodes in a 1sq radius, applying 15 Verve Loss, and the Dazed and Dumb Statused.  If the user has this Status, applies Dying instead.

movedesc: Waving beak and legs as its body visually duplicates with multiple images of itself.
moveeffects: Applies the Scrambled: Confused Status (DC4)

movedesc: Creates illusory duplicates of itself, but only if its Confusing Scent fails.
moveeffects: Gains duplicates of itself equal to twice the number of opponents.  Each duplicate mimics the actions of the real Bloomlurk, though only applies 5 Verve Loss, and no Statuses.

movedesc: Releases a scent from it's scent vents.
moveeffects: As a Free Action, may move all creatures 2 sq.

name: Farfeeder
movedesc: One of the feeder's runners within the walls and ceiling brings down earth and rock on its foes.
moveeffects: 40 Verve Loss in a Volume.
resistances:
AcRes(10),
PoiRes(10),
PyRes(5),
ZephRes(-5),
ElecRes(-5),
CryRes(-5)
description:
The horrifying Farfeeder is a green creature resembling an enormous bulbous plant.  It's feet and body are huge petal-like fleshy leaves that wrap from the roots on the floor around to a bulbous midsection.  From the topmost point where the petals wrap together, a mass of green tentacles grows, forming an eye at the top.  It resides in shallow caves and is tethered to the ground and cannot move.  For that reason, it must rely on compelling weak-minded individuals to feed it and expand its nest.

The Farfeeder sends out a network of green feeders throughout the lands, poking up every now and then and emitting a fine scent that is attractive to grazing animals.  Each feeder contains one of its compulsion seeds that, when eaten, infects the animal.  The seed roots in the stomach and feeds on nourishment to produce more seeds, though when seeded a creature cannot be reseeded by the seeds they start producing.  Each seed survives for around 2 lapses.

During seeding, infected creatures are compelled to visit the Farfeeder with meat, to carve out a larger cave for it, and to receive a new seed for reinfection - then the compulsions fade for a short while and they return to their normal lives.  The compulsion is subtle; the seeded are unaware that this compulsion is active, and rarely remember when they were compelled - but similarly a seeded person can be shaken from it fairly easily.

If found in its lair by non-seeded creature, the Farfeeder will remain as still as possible to avoid conflict.  But if investigated or attacked, it will bring the cave down around it (saving itself), and then hurriedly send as many feeders out with reproduction seeds that tries to grow a new Farfeeder in a stomach, but requires a large animal with enough flesh, like a fat cow.  For this reason reproduction is rare.

If a Farfeeder is killed, all active seeds continue to live, though anyone compelled becomes confused instead of following the compulsions.  Reproduction seeds may indeed still make another Farfeeder.

movedesc: If threatened, the Farfeeder agitates all feeder runners throughout its cave, bringing the entire cave down around it, but saving itself.
moveeffects: Applies 200 Verve Loss to all trapped within.

movedesc: Grabs up to 2 creatures within its Threat Range with its unwrapped petals.
moveeffects: Applies the Grappled Status.

movedesc: Any creature it has grappled and pulled into its body is crushed and digested with its acids.
moveeffects: Applies 80 Verve Loss.

name: Mothergrell Spider
movedesc: A terrifying bite from multiple jaws.
moveeffects: Aapplies 18 Verve Loss and a DC2 Poison.

movedesc: Shoots a sticky mass of webbing.
moveeffects: Creates a Volume Shape which removes the Relocate Movement of those who fail to Save, and halves the movement of those who do.

movedesc: The Mothergrell's thorax splits with a weeping blue ichor.
moveeffects: Releases 5 swarms of Grell Spiders.

name: Grell Spider (Swarm)
movedesc: A biting attack from a swarm of chittering spiders, all about your person.
moveeffects: Applies 6 Verve Loss.

name: Lectus
movedesc: Flicks its agile legs out for a scraping attack.
moveeffects: Applied 15 Verve Loss.
description: A horrific creature of clawed legs, which is surprisingly small and light.  It’s signature move is to grasp its prey’s body with one leg, straighten it so that its own body is perpendicular, and to crush with its grasping leg and slash with its others.  It can also climb about its prey body, often also seen climbing up and grasping its prey’s shoulder instead.

movedesc: Grasps onto an opponent, and only killing it will make it let go.
moveeffects: Can climb all over its target, and while attached it gets 2 Leg Swipes.

name: Detwrack, Unsated
movedesc: A whip-lash flick of each of its tentacles.
moveeffects: Applies 15 Verve Loss, per tentacle.
description: A force of neither good nor evil, the Detwrack feeds on death, decomposing corpses and death that it finds.

movedesc: The Detwrack bursts new tentacles from the ground.
moveeffects: As a Free Action, the Detwrack creates 2 new tentacles.

movedesc: The Detwrack emits a noxious black gas.
moveeffects: Applies the Discordant: Limited (DC 3) and DoT: Poisoned (DC 3) Statuses.

movedesc: The Detwrack wraps its tentacles around a creature with the Dying Status.
moveeffects: The target is drained of 10 Verve, and it's next Stabilise Move fails.  The Detwrack Restores twice the stolen Verve.

name: Detwrack, Sated
movedesc: A whip-lash flick of each of its tentacles.
moveeffects: Applies 28 Verve Loss, per tentacle.
description: A force of neither good nor evil, the Detwrack feeds on death, decomposing corpses and death that it finds.

movedesc: The Detwrack bursts new tentacles from the ground.
moveeffects: As a Free Action, the Detwrack creates 3 new tentacles.

movedesc: The Detwrack emits a noxious black gas.
moveeffects: Applies the Discordant: Limited (DC 3) and DoT: Poisoned (DC 3) Statuses.

movedesc: The Detwrack wraps its tentacles around a creature with the Dying Status.
moveeffects: The target is drained of 10 Verve, and it's next Stabilise Move fails.  The Detwrack Restores twice the stolen Verve.

name: Idbeast, Humanoid
movedesc: Migranic attacks assault your very identity.
moveeffects: Applies 16 Verve Loss.
description:
The Nostagian Idbeasts are a creature formed of pure Intellect and Psychic Resonance.  Some say they are the result of nearing the Scintellating Horizon, as they appeared not long after Psionics were propagated.  It is uncertain whether these creatures are of our world.

Idbeasts are attracted to areas of heightened emotion and intellect.  Thankfully the Prescintellate keeps their threat at bay.

movedesc: Psychically links 2 enemies.
moveeffects: When one receives Psychic Verve Loss or a Mental Status, so does the other.

movedesc: Waves of psychic power disorient a target.
moveeffects: Applies 10 Verve Loss and its choice of the Scrambled: Dazed (DC3), or Confused (DC3) Status.

movedesc: The Idbeast can psychically shift through space.  Psionically Awakened are unsure how they do this...
moveeffects: Moves to a new location within 3 sq. and gain the Stealthed Status.

name: Idbeast, Canine
movedesc: A bite from a dog like creature whose eyes penetrate the soul.
moveeffects: Applies 14 Verve Loss.
description:
The Nostagian Idbeasts are a creature formed of pure Intellect and Psychic Resonance.  Some say they are the result of nearing the Scintellating Horizon, as they appeared not long after Psionics were propagated.  It is uncertain whether these creatures are of our world.

Idbeasts are attracted to areas of heightened emotion and intellect.  Thankfully the Prescintellate keeps their threat at bay.

movedesc: Lets out a soul-wrenching howl.
moveeffects: Applies the Bound (DC 1) Status for 1 round.

movedesc: The Idbeast can psychically shift through space.  Psionically Awakened are unsure how they do this...
moveeffects: Moves to a new location within sight.

name: Idbeast, Lesser
movedesc: Migranic attacks assault your very identity.
moveeffects: Applies 10 Verve Loss.
description:
The Nostagian Idbeasts are a creature formed of pure Intellect and Psychic Resonance.  Some say they are the result of nearing the Scintellating Horizon, as they appeared not long after Psionics were propagated.  It is uncertain whether these creatures are of our world.

Idbeasts are attracted to areas of heightened emotion and intellect.  Thankfully the Prescintellate keeps their threat at bay.

movedesc: Psychically links 2 enemies.
moveeffects: When one receives Psychic Verve Loss or a Mental Status, so does the other.

movedesc: Latches to an opponent's head and leeches their intellect.
moveeffects: Applies 20 Verve Loss.

name: Zeriist, Serpent
movedesc: A grand strike with mouth, teeth and feathered winglets.
moveeffects: Applies 30 Verve Loss to all across it's path.
description: A serpent made of the collective dreams of the Zerriolites

movedesc: Creates an illusion of broken ground and imaginary fighters.
moveeffects: When those affected discover that this is an illusion, it disappears but applies the Enfeebled: Mental Status for one round.

movedesc: Shifts aggressively through the space, slamming anyone it comes in contact with.
moveeffects: Applies 20 Verve Loss to anyone within 3 squares of it's anywhere it was or moved through.

movedesc: Creates a yellow cloud of sparkling energies.
moveeffects: Applies the Fortified (DC 3) and Unnerved: Dissuaded (DC 3) Statuses.

name: Mother's Maladite
movedesc: An assault on your id to assail your senses.
moveeffects: Applies 5 Verve Loss and the Blind / Invisible: Blind and Deaf / Silent: Deaf Statuses.
description:
A creature that mimics the form of something that a humanoid wants, and which will bring it close.  For this reason, it often turns into babies for unlucky mothers, and jewellry.  When alone, it transforms parts of itself back to a leeching black oozing mass, and drains the parent of their life force.  The drained can never see the true form, and become fascinated and overprotective of the Maladite, so much that they will protect it with their life.

The Maladite has extreme physical and magical resistance to those that cannot truly see it.  Magical divinations, detections and illusion dispels are twisted, such that the magic user knows that something is up, but cannot glean real information about it.

The Maladite’s true form can only be seen freely by one who truly wants for nothing, though burning Palomile and Gandra also dispels its Illusory Form.

movedesc: Creates a complex illusion.
moveeffects: The Maladite can adopt the shape of any creature or item, and can mask its movements as well.  Those affected may only save if they see the Maladite manifesting this ability.

movedesc: Bonds to a creature, becoming the object of their most intense desire.
moveeffects: Those affected will fight for the Maladite with their life, treating it as the most dearest thing in the world.

name: Carrion Carver
movedesc: Lashes out with razor bone limbs
moveeffects: Applies 25 Verve Loss 5 times to targets within its Threatened Area.  Will prefer to distribute these attacks equally, where possible.
description: A product of Ihn’egretcal Flow coalescing and festering, the Carrion Collector is an amalgamation of other bones of creatures forming into a tall, long-legged creature.  It lives in dark spaces, sometimes creating a burrow, and slowly feeds on the bones it has collected.  However when the bone hoard is used up, it needs to hunt.  This is usually as little as once every few years, but the event is horrific.  It clambers and climbs and hides where it can, striking at travellers and smaller villages, and harvests their bodies - alive or dead - storing them in its bone-cage body to take back to its nest.

movedesc: A sweeping attack in a semi-circle by its elongated limbs.
moveeffects: Applies 30 Verve Loss and the Trip Status to all in a quarter of an Aura Shape.

movedesc: Grasps a combatant in its retracting bone leg.
moveeffects: Grasps and places a target within the serrated cage in its chest.

movedesc: The serrated bones whisper an umbral song to those within the cage.
moveeffects: As a Free Action, applies the Enfeebled: Mental and Scrambled: Paralyses Statuses.

movedesc: When threatened in its lair, the Carrion Carver gains a terrible rage.
moveeffects: Gains the Temporality: Hasted Status, 30 Verve, and attacks apply an additional 10 Verve.

name: Remembrance
movedesc: Psychically insinuates the mind of a target, attempting to limit it.
moveeffects: Applies the Bound (DC 1) Status.
description:
The Remembrance is the echoing resonance of a Psionic whose life was cut short by violent magics while they manifested Telepathy or Clairvoyance.  The resultant creature is not truly deceased, not truly Undead, but a simalacrum of life with all the same properties.  They cannot remember who they are, and so take the form of someone they see at their death or near after, though there is something off about their look, and they imitate them poorly.

The Remembrance has a deep urge to remember, and so they use the remants of their psionic abilities to insert memories of their new forme into those around them, in the hopes of building a new existence.  Initially this is done by overlapping their ethereal form with another, and eventually they can do when near, and then afar.  Each time they do so successfully, they grow in power.

Particularly powerful Remembrances - ones that have built themselves memories in the minds of others - have a chaotic, evil persona, and strive for larger and more wide-spread memories.

The ironic condition of the Remembrance is that the more it successfully uses Memory Overlay - it's preference when threatened into combat - the more it solidifies and becomes succeptible to physical attacks.

movedesc: The Remembrance modifies your recent memories.
moveeffects: The Remembrance becomes invisible and undetectable.

movedesc: By occupying the same space, the Remembrance surfaces memories from the past, and inserts itself in any shape or form.
moveeffects: Resolve a role-played scene from the target's past.  The Remembrance takes a role in that memory, attempting to reshape it to the target's failure or fears.  Once the scene has ended, resolve the Defence.  If failed, the target gains the Unnerved: Dissuaded and Scrambled: Confused (DC 3) Statuses when performing actions against the Remembrance, and the Remembrance loses 5 PRes as it solidifies.

movedesc: If subjects wise up to Memory Overlays, the Remembrance instead flees, first emitting a wailing Psychic blast.
moveeffects: Applies 15 Verve Loss.

name: Generic Warrior (DC1)
movedesc: A mighty attack with their weapon.
moveeffects: Applies 12 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A mighty shot with a crossbow or bow.
moveeffects: Applies 10 Verve Loss.

name: Generic Warrior (DC2)
movedesc: A mighty attack with their weapon.
moveeffects: Applies 15 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A mighty shot with a crossbow or bow.
moveeffects: Applies 12 Verve Loss.

name: Generic Warrior (DC3)
movedesc: A mighty attack with their weapon.
moveeffects: Applies 20 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A mighty shot with a crossbow or bow.
moveeffects: Applies 18 Verve Loss.

name: Generic Rogue (DC1)
movedesc: A slash with deadly daggers.
moveeffects: Applies 10 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A sneaky backstab.
moveeffects: Applies 20 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A sly shot with a crossbow.
moveeffects: Applies 12 Verve Loss.

name: Generic Rogue (DC2)
movedesc: A slash with deadly daggers.
moveeffects: Applies 12 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A sneaky backstab.
moveeffects: Applies 25 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A sly shot with a crossbow.
moveeffects: Applies 15 Verve Loss.

name: Generic Rogue (DC3)
movedesc: A slash with deadly daggers.
moveeffects: Applies 118 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A sneaky backstab.
moveeffects: Applies 30 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A sly shot with a crossbow.
moveeffects: Applies 20 Verve Loss.

name: Generic Mage (DC1)
movedesc: A smack with a tome or staff.
moveeffects: Applies 8 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A weaving of magical energies.
moveeffects: Can cast the Cantrip of: Energistic Bolt, Stonerous Skin, Curse Vervorium, Dispellus, Corpus/Mentus Enhanceum, Sleepening, Teleportum Jauntus.

name: Generic Mage (DC2)
movedesc: A smack with a tome or staff.
moveeffects: Applies 10 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A weaving of magical energies.
moveeffects: Can Cast the Standard of: Energistic Bolt, Stonerous Skin, Curse Vervorium, Dispellus, Corpus/Mentus Enhanceum, Sleepening, Corpus Delayum/Hastum, Confusative, Teleportum Jauntus.

name: Generic Mage (DC3)
movedesc: A smack with a tome or staff.
moveeffects: Applies 12 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A weaving of magical energies.
moveeffects: Can Cast the Standard of: Energistic Bolt/Burst/Beam, Stonerous Skin, Curse Vervorium, Dispellus, Corpus/Mentus Enhanceum, Sleepening, Corpus Delayum/Hastum, Confusative, Teleportum Jauntus.

movedesc: A terrible weaving of magical energies.
moveeffects: Can Cast the Overpowered version of one of their known spells.

name: Aurora Impiorium Aspirant
movedesc: An erratic whack of a billy club.
moveeffects: Applies 10 Verve Loss.

movedesc: Thrown knives and shuriken.
moveeffects: Applies 10 Verve Loss.

name: Aurora Impiorium Striker
movedesc: An erratic slash of a knife, and a second attack with the spikes of their armour.
moveeffects: Applies 10 Verve Loss, as well as the DoT: Poisoned (DC 1) Status.

movedesc: Upon taking critical damage, the Striker's cocktail of enhacements give them a few more wailing thrashes.
moveeffects: Applies 10 Verve Loss to up to 5 different targets.

movedesc: An erratic thrown of various bladed tools and weapons.
moveeffects: Applies 12 Verve Loss.

movedesc: The Striker gleefully applies a small prick from a needle in their gauntlet.
moveeffects: Applies an unresistable DoT: Poison (Dc 3) Status, however a successful Defend ignore this.

name: Aurora Impiorium Deceiver
movedesc: An erratic slash of a knife, and a second attack with the spikes of their armour.
moveeffects: Applies 15 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A quick reveal of a hidden crossbow, and the forthcoming thunk of the string.
moveeffects: Applies 12 Verve Loss.

movedesc: A weaving of magical energies.
moveeffects: Can Cast the Standard of: Fly, Energistic Wall, Vervatious Restorium, Energistic Cone, Corpus Detractum, Mentus Detractum, Corpus Constrictum, Darkenis.

movedesc: Through long-term conditioning, the Deceiver can whip their allies into frenzies.
moveeffects: Applies the Unnerved: Aggravated Status to their allies.

name: Aea
movedesc: Aea uses daggers and her own body with amazing skill.
moveeffects: Applies 30 Verve Loss with each of 2 attacks.

movedesc: Aea throws galactic stars from her cloak.
moveeffects: Applies 30 Verve Loss, distributed to any number of targets in a cone.

movedesc: Aea wraps her cloak around herself.
moveeffects: Applies the Blind / Unseen: Unseen Status, and Ethereal to herself for up to 3 rounds.  Additionally applies MRes 20.

movedesc: Aea rummages in her bags, finding just the right thing.
moveeffects: Aea can cast any spell from a Rune.

name: Varrithen
movedesc: Keen and agile slices with magical blades.
moveeffects: Applies 25 Verve Loss with each of 3 attacks.

movedesc: Varrithen smartly controls the battlefield, engaging a single target in a duel.
moveeffects: When duelling Varrithen gains +1 attack against his target, and if they flee or disengage (by resolving Resisting: Mental), he immediately applies an attack as a Free Action.

movedesc: Varrithen uses the confusion of melee to distracts his opponent, distracting all around and slipping out of combat.
moveeffects: Varrithen gains a Relocate Action as a Free Action, gaining 6sq, as well as applying the Scrambled: Confused (DC 2) Status for 1 Round to all within sight.

movedesc: With astonishing speed, Varrithen slips around behind a target.
moveeffects: Varrithen gains the Flanking and Stealth Statuses, to perform a Sneak Attack which applies 40 Verve Loss.

name: Galacie
movedesc: A spread of fingers, riming with ice.
moveeffects: Applies 25 Verve Loss.

movedesc: Raising her arms, Galacie wrenches ice walls from moisture in the ground.
moveeffects: Create up to 5 Ice Walls, each with 40 Verve, curved or straight, anywhere on the battlefield.

movedesc: A weaving of magical energies.
moveeffects: Can Cast the Standards of Stoneskin (Ice), Energistic Storm (Cryal), Energistic Totem (cryal).  Dispellus.  Corpus Revulsion.  Fly (Ice Creations).  Corpus Delayum.  Conjurus Mist.  Energistic Control.

movedesc: A terrible weaving of magical energies.
moveeffects: Can Cast the Overpowered version of one of her known spells.

movedesc: Galacie releases a spell she had prepared earlier.
moveeffects: As a Free Action, can cast the Standard Version of one of her spells.

name: Delmon Altruit
movedesc: Delmon clubs with simple, dull knives.
moveeffects: Applies 20 Verve Loss (non-lethal) with 2 attacks.

movedesc: Delmon can Sneak Attack people he flanks or is stealthed with.
moveeffects: Applies 60 Verve Loss (non-lethal), and the Bound Status.

movedesc: Delmon has an item that he can turn invisible with.
moveeffects: Gains the Blind / Invisible: Invisible Status.

movedesc: With almost supernatural quickness, Delmon knocks around the head foes who are within 10 sq. of each other.
moveeffects: Applies the Scrambled: Stunned Status to up to 6 targets.

name: Adeline
movedesc: Two mauling strikes that ring a sweet vibration one hit.
moveeffects: Two attacks which apply 12 Verve Loss.

movedesc: Adeline whispers to her patron, and is encased in luminal and umbral light.
moveeffects: Gains 20 UDR.

movedesc: Adeline reaches to the sky and the ground, summoning great weaved energies.
moveeffects: Can Cast the Standard of: Energistic Meteors (Umbral and Luminal), Protection from Caustic, Protection from Transcendent, Dispellus, Flow Reflectorium.

movedesc: Adeline smashes her hammer on the ground, creating a volume of blinding light which floods in with darkness after.
moveeffects: Applies 25 Verve Loss to all enemies within an Aura Shape.
